item.title: Implementing a Backend Service in Rust — Part 1
item.description: I’ve been using Rust for quite a while now. Most notably, I’ve been involved in the development of eventually-rs, a Rust crate providing support for Event-sourced applications. My background has to do with Systems Programming and Backend Development, which was the main drive for creating eventually. In the process of writing the crate, I’ve been reimplementing a couple of those microservices I was currently working on on my daily job, as a sort of testing project to validate the soundness of the crate and its design decisions.
